docs.lead_paragraph: A judge on Thursday blocked Kansas' first-in-the-nation ban on an abortion procedure that opponents describe as dismembering a fetus, concluding that the law would likely present too big of an obstacle for women seeking to end their pregnancies.

headline.main: Judge Blocks Kansas' Ban on 2nd-Trimester Abortion Procedure
headline.print_headline: Judge Blocks Kansas' Ban on 2nd-Trimester Abortion Procedure

docs.snippet: A judge on Thursday blocked Kansas' first-in-the-nation ban on an abortion procedure that opponents describe as dismembering a fetus, concluding that the law would likely present too big of an obstacle for women seeking to end their pregnancies.

docs.lead_paragraph: England, upstate New York and Manila are among the settings authors have chosen for their new novels.

headline.main: Reviews: New Books From Sarah Hall, Mia Alvar, Katherine Taylor and Others

docs.abstract: Carmela Ciuraru reviews books The Wolf Border by Sarah Hall, The Household Spirit by Tod Wodicka, The Loved Ones by Mary-Beth Hughes, Summerlong by Dean Bakopoulos, Valley Fever by Katherine Taylor and In the Country: Stories by Mia Alvar.
docs.snippet: England, upstate New York and Manila are among the settings authors have chosen for their new novels.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Ohio Senate passed a bill on Wednesday that would ban abortions after 20 weeks of gestation, following the passage of a similar ban by the Wisconsin Senate this month.

headline.main: Ohio Senate Passes Bill Banning Abortion After 20 Weeks
headline.print_headline: Ohio Senate Passes Bill Banning Abortion After 20 Weeks

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans controlling the powerful House Appropriations panel Wednesday adopted a sweeping spending bill that seeks to protect popular programs like health research, drug treatment and AIDS prevention but slashes education grants and funding for family planning centers and community service programs.

headline.main: House Panel OKs Cuts to Education, Boosts Medical Research
headline.print_headline: House Panel OKs Cuts to Education, Boosts Medical Research

docs.lead_paragraph: An abortion rights group is asking a Kansas judge to block the state's first-in-the-nation ban on what it says is the most common method for terminating second-trimester pregnancies, contending that the new law would force women to either accept higher medical risks or forgo abortions.

docs.lead_paragraph: A group of Satanic worshippers are suing Missouri's governor and attorney general in federal court, alleging that the state's abortion restrictions violate their religious beliefs and should be scrapped.

headline.main: Satanic Group's Suit: Missouri Abortion Law Violates Beliefs

docs.lead_paragraph: The Vatican set the stage Tuesday for another round of debate on hot-button issues like gays, remarried Catholics and unmarried couples living together with a working document that confirmed a rollback on welcoming gays into the church.

headline.main: Vatican Sets Stage for Family Debate With Working Document
headline.print_headline: Vatican Sets Stage for Family Debate With Working Document

docs.lead_paragraph: After Dr. Eleni Michailidis delivered a stillborn son, she and her husband sought to honor their infant and the experience.

headline.main: After a Stillbirth, a Silent Delivery Room

docs.abstract: Dr Eleni Michailidis describes experience she and her husband went through when their son Alexander was stillborn.
